title: Taliban 'brutally' killed a popular Afghan folk singer just days after it said 'music is forbidden' in Islam, former minister says
content:
1. Taliban 'brutally' killed a popular Afghan folk singer just days after it said 'music is forbidden' in Islam, former minister says  Yahoo News
  2. Pentagon says Haqqani network ‘co-mingling’ with Taliban after State Dept calls them 'separate entities'  Fox News
  3. Afghan President Ashraf Ghani fled Kabul so quickly fearing execution by the Taliban that aides who returned from a lunch break wondered where he'd gone  Yahoo! Voices
  4. Inclusive govt to be formed within days: Mujahid  Pajhwok Afghan News
  5. The Observer view on the resurgence of the Taliban  The Guardian
  6. View Full Coverage on Google News
contentSnippet:
Taliban 'brutally' killed a popular Afghan folk singer just days after it said 'music is forbidden' in Islam, former minister says  Yahoo News
Pentagon says Haqqani network ‘co-mingling’ with Taliban after State Dept calls them 'separate entities'  Fox News
Afghan President Ashraf Ghani fled Kabul so quickly fearing execution by the Taliban that aides who returned from a lunch break wondered where he'd gone  Yahoo! Voices
Inclusive govt to be formed within days: Mujahid  Pajhwok Afghan News
The Observer view on the resurgence of the Taliban  The Guardian

localize.title: タリバンがアフガニスタンの人気フォークシンガーを「残酷に」殺害したのは、イスラム教で「音楽は禁じられている」と発言した数日後だったと元大臣が語る。
前部长称塔利班 "残忍 "地杀害了一名受欢迎的阿富汗民谣歌手，就在塔利班称伊斯兰教 "禁止音乐 "的几天之后
前部長稱塔利班 "殘忍 "地殺害了一名受歡迎的阿富汗民謠歌手，就在塔利班稱伊斯蘭教 "禁止音樂 "的幾天之後
